item.title: Raging song By Kygo
item.itunes:author: karkhung
item.itunes:subtitle: karkhung: Raging song By Kygo
item.itunes:summary: Microsoft and Google have famously been all about software, but that's changed significantly over the last few years. Microsoft and now Google have graduated to making their own hardware. Both companies traditionally licensed (or gave away) their software to run on devices made by other manufacturers. So why the move from software to hardware? BONUS: We geek out for another 20 minutes at the end of the episode discussing the new hardware releases. It's a bit of a response to some of the discussion we had back in episode 1.

item.title: Can someone explain drones to me?
item.itunes:author: karkhung
item.itunes:subtitle: karkhung: Can someone explain drones to me?
item.itunes:summary: Drones seem to be the big thing at the moment but with a battery life of about 20 minutes usage is pretty short. So why are they touted as the next big thing?
item.description: Drones seem to be the big thing at the moment but with a battery life of about 20 minutes usage is pretty short. So why are they touted as the next big thing? item.title: Learning for Free
item.itunes:author: karkhung
item.itunes:subtitle: karkhung: Learning for Free
item.itunes:summary: The internet is an amazing resource of free and available content - so how can we utilise that to learn?

item.title: Hiding Behind Technology
item.itunes:author: karkhung
item.itunes:subtitle: karkhung: Hiding Behind Technology
item.itunes:summary: Digital technology represents an abstraction from the real world. It technical and programatic nature allow it to hide and conceal what's really happening in our world.
item.description: Digital technology represents an abstraction from the real world. It technical and programatic nature allow it to hide and conceal what's really happening in our world. Digital technology represents an abstraction from the real world. It technical and programatic nature allow it to hide and conceal what's really happening in our world. Show Notes Available at http://localhost:4000/2016/episode-4.html.
item.itunes:keywords: technology, VR, refugees, cloud, labour, uber, facebook,
